member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.TypeCoercionMode
member.summary: Settings that configure the degree of type-coercion performed during an export operation to Excel.

remarks.p: Type coercion is an export procedure that takes place as every cell within the UltraWebGrid is exported. It is partly responsible for avoiding the "Number formatted as text" warning that Excel displays when a numeric value is exported as text. Ordinarily, only minimal type coercion needs to take place because the UltraWebGrid obtains strong type information from the data source to which it is bound. This is accomplished by the Default setting.

When the data source doesn't possess strong type information for the UltraWebGrid (for example, the data source is untyped XML or consists of DataTables having DataColumns with uninitialized DataTypes that default to String), then some applications may apply their type knowledge to the DataType property of the grid's UltraGridColumns.

In this second situation the Value of each UltraGridCell remains text, even though the developer may have assigned type information about the UltraGridColumn to its DataType. To avoid receiving "Number formatted as text" warnings for these cells in the exported spreadsheet, these developers can set their type coercion mode to ConvertText. In this more intensive mode, the exporter parses all text in these columns in an effort to retrieve the underlying value as its true type. The ConvertText mode eliminates "Number formatted as text" warnings in weakly typed situations such as these where the only type information available is through the DataType property of the UltraGridColumn, but it adds considerable overhead to the processing necessary to export to Excel.
Developers are encouraged to avoid needing to use ConvertText by specifying the DataType of their ADO.NET DataColumn objects before data-binding.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.TypeCoercionMode.Default
member.summary: Values are formatted according to the Data Type of the original data source column (i.e., ADO.NET DataColumn). This is the default.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.TypeCoercionMode.ConvertText
member.summary: Values are formatted during the export according to the Data Type on the UltraGridColumn when the value appears in the original data source as text. This more intensive type coercion mode requires parsing formatted text cell values, and is therefore less efficient.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents
member.summary: Interface describing the events developers may subscribe themselves to from the UltraWebGridExcelExporter.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.BeginExport
member.summary: Occurs before the UltraWebGrid export starts.

remarks.p: The Layout argument returns a reference to a cloned UltraGridLayout used for excel exporting. Any changes you make to this layout will be reflected in exported file and not in the original grid layout.
The Rows argument returns a reference to a original rows collection in top band.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before all other events. You can use it to do any preprocessing before exporting process starts. For example, you can set properties on cloned layout or write some custom header to Excel workbook.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.InitializeRow
member.summary: Occurs when each UltraWebGrid row is initialized.

remarks.p: The Row argument returns a reference to a grid row which is being exported.
The SkipRow argument specifies whether to skip the current row. This argument doesn't affect exporting of descendant rows.
The SkipDescendants argument specifies whether to skip the descendats of the current row.
The SkipSiblings argument specifies whether to skip sibling rows of the current row.
The TerminateExport argument specifies whether to terminate the export process. Current row will not be processed.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired for every grid row which is being exported, and before and are fired. Use this event to set grid row specific properties and to control exporting process.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.InitializeColumn
member.summary: Occurs when an UltraWebGrid column is initialized.

remarks.p: The FormatString argument has value only if the column has format string assigned. Its value represents a format string in the .NET Framework's format.
If needed, the ExcelFormatString argument should be set to a Microsoft Excel-specific format string. If left uninitialized, cells within this column will have no specific format.

This event is fired when a grid column is initialized for the first time (when the first cell in that column is about to be exported). Developers should handle this event to convert format strings from the .NET Framework format into their analogous Microsoft Excel format. Please see the .NET Framework documentation and Excel help file for more information about the differences in their format strings.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.RowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before an UltraWebGrid row is exported to Microsoft Excel format.

remarks.p: The GridRow argument returns a reference to row being exported.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before excel row with grid data is processed. Use Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If grid rows spans multiple Excel rows (like in row layout mode), this event is fired only for first row.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.RowExported
member.summary: Occurs after an UltraWebGrid row is exported to Microsoft Excel format.

remarks.p: The GridRow argument returns a reference to row being exported.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired after an Excel row with grid data is processed. Use it to apply any additional formatting to an Excel row. If grid rows span multiple Excel rows (like in row layout mode), this event is fired only for last row in the span.
This event does not fire if an event handler has cancelled the event.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.SummaryRowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before summary row is exported to Microsoft Excel format.

remarks.p: The Summaries argument returns a reference to summary values.
The SummaryLevel argument returns a current summary level.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before excel row with summary values for specific level is processed. Use Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If summaries span multiple Excel rows (like in row layout mode), this event is fired only for first row of summaries.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.IGenerateGridExportEvents.EndExport
member.summary: Occurs after the UltraWebGrid export is finished.

remarks.p: The Cancelled argument is true if exporting process has been cancelled.
This event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired after the exporting process has finished and is fired after all other events. The exported document is not sent to the client until the processing of the web form completes. Developers may handle this event for any post-processing of the finished Microsoft Excel Workbook before it is serialized to the client.

member.summary: ExcelExportCancelEventArgs is a base class for cancellable event argument classes.

remarks.p: Many events occur in before/after pairings where the before event permits developers a chance to pre-empt an activity that the event provides notice to them of. When developers have set the Cancel property in their event handlers subscribed to cancellable 'before' events to true, the corresponding 'after' event will not fire because the activity will have been pre-empted.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs
member.summary: Event parameters used for the event.

remarks.p: These event arguments give developers an opportunity to override the strict filtering performed by UltraWebGridExcelExporter on the DownloadName and WorksheetName properties when they are assigned. Sometimes web applications need to relax these restrictions.

In the simplest situation, developers may assign a filename that they know to be safe to the DownloadName property and subscribe an event handler to this event. In their NameValidating event handler, the developer examines the to ensure it meets their own security criteria, and assigns it to the property. This "opt-in" assignment to override the pre-filtered name is a failsafe mechanism ensuring continued backwards compatibility.
If the proposed name fails to meet security criteria, the developer may set the Cancel flag on these event arguments. When cancelled, the name reverts to the .

Names validated by the NameValidating event will appear in network protocol control fields and unmanaged operating system API calls on the user's machine. It is very important to verify the name assigned doesn't contain malformed text or unvalidated user input.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the NameValidatingEventArgs based on the old, new, and filtered names for a property that requires additional validation.
member.param: Name of the property being validated.
The original value of propertyName prior to having a new value assigned to it.
The assigned value of propertyName set by the web application.
The pre-filtered version of the proposedName that has been truncated to a reasonable length and had all whitespace, punctuation, and non-alphanumeric characters removed.

remarks.p: Application developers should not find it necessary to create their own instances of NameValidatingEventArgs. These event arguments are created by the Infragistics control infrastructure when it is necessary to trigger the NameValidating event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs.ApprovedName
member.summary: Name property value that has met all validation requirements, and will be used in the exported spreadsheet received by the user.

remarks.p: An approved name that has met the validation requirements of all listeners of the NameValidating event. Depending on the , this name will appear in protocol control fields and unmanaged operating system function calls taking place on the end user's machine, so it must be carefully validated to ensure its safety.

Certain name assignments (including long names, names containing escape characters or other invalid characters) may provoke an exception, or cause undefined behavior. It is not always possible to detect these problems on the server-side. What factors constitute an 'invalid' character may be subject to the configuration of the intervening network (firewalls, routers) and the end user's machine (operating system, file system).

If any event handler of NameValidating cancels the event by settings the Cancel property to true, then the name rolls back to the , instead of the approved name. The original name was either an initial default value known to be safe, or one that had been previously validated.
When there is doubt about the safety of the , do not override the pre-filtered name initially assigned to this property by the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs.OriginalName
member.summary: Pre-existing name that was previously assigned (and validated) or initialized. Read Only.

remarks.p: Developers handling the NameValidating event can choose to cancel the event by setting the Cancel property to true. When doing so the ProposedName is disregarded, while the original value contained by this property gets retained.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs.PropertyName
member.summary: Property name that has been assigned a new value. Read Only.

remarks.p: Currently this can have one of two values: DownloadName is the name that appears in the HTTP (Hyper Text Transport Protocol) headers and gets saved on the end users' file system; and WorksheetName which is the name of the active worksheet on the exported workbook that appears in certain places in the OLE2 structured storage file containing the spreadsheet data. The values assigned to both of these properties are subject to extra scrutiny as a recommended security precaution.
Additional properties may be added to this list in the future. Any NameValidatingEventHandler method should check the PropertyName to determine any validation criteria that may be necessary.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.NameValidatingEventArgs.ProposedName
member.summary: Name property value that has been suggested by the application. Read Only.

remarks.p: Contains the new name suggested by the application in an assignment to the property identified by . In order for the property to accept the proposed name, the developer assigns the ProposedName (possibly modified) to the after it has undergone any validation logic within their NameValidating event handler.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter
member.summary: The UltraGrid Excel Exporter control provides exporting functionality to Microsoft Excel 97 and later.

remarks.p: Developers can use the export features of this control by dragging it onto a Web Form containing an UltraWebGrid control that they wish to export to Microsoft Excel 97 or later format (also known as Binary Interchange File Format, or BIFF, revision 8).

This control is non-visual in nature, meaning it does not render any HTML to the client browser. An export is performed by calling the method on an UltraWebGrid instance. At that time, the exporter can take control of the Page such that other controls on the page do not render, and it streams the exported data to the client's browser.

Nevertheless, developers can customize several facets of the exporter's processing declaratively from within the Properties Editor. Developers should set the following behavioral properties that govern the parameters of the export operation:

td.p: Determines whether the exported spreadsheet should attempt to open InBrowser with in-place activation, if the client supports it, or as a plain file Download.
Developers may also choose a Custom mode, in which their web application is responsible for using the Export method and other logic to deliver the spreadsheet in a nontraditional manner.
Customizes the name of the file that will be created on the client's file system (even when opening in-place, the client's browser will cache the spreadsheet file locally using this filename).
Customizes the name of the active worksheet that appears on the tab bar beneath the spreadsheet.
These properties direct the export operation to take place at a location other than the top-left corner of the spreadsheet.

remarks.p: It is also possible to specify or default these parameters at run-time in the arguments of the method, which is usually called as part of an event handler within the web application (for instance, when the end user clicks a Button control to initiate the download of an exported spreadsheet).

During the export, a diverse event model is exposed that permits developers to customize the appearance and formatting of the exported spreadsheet. In some situations, event handling may be necessary for advanced web applications to mediate .NET format specifiers into Microsoft Excel formats during the export, or achieve greater styling of the final product's appearance than is possible through the automated conversion of a web styles into Excel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.ExportMode
member.summary: Determines what export behavior the control takes automatically when Export has been called.

remarks.p: By default, the automatically sends the results of an export operation to the client browser whenever has been called from server-side ASP.NET code as part of the HTTP Response. Developers can customize this behavior and the user experience it affords UltraWebGrid applications with this property.

Normally, the exported spreadsheet is downloaded by the end user's browser, and the end user can choose to Open (if they have Microsoft Excel 97 or later installed), Save or Cancel the download. Different browsers may display this notice to the end user in different manners. In particular, some browsers may display a warning message concerning the security ramifications of opening untrusted binary downloads.

When using InBrowser, even though the exported spreadsheet appears within an interactive application window, end users can still save a copy to their local file system through Excel's File | Save command.

If InBrowser is specified, but the client machine does not have Microsoft Excel 97 or later installed (or the file extension affiliation that would automatically launch Excel within the browser has been modified in their configuration), then the ExportMode falls back and behaves like Download.

When Custom is specified, the developer assumes all responsibility for directing the exported BIFF8 file stream (it is not automatically sent to the client browser). This mode might be used by advanced applications that require sending the exported file across a NetworkStream or saving it into a file located on the server using one of the overloads of the Export method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.WorksheetName
member.summary: Name given to the Worksheet in an exported Workbook.

remarks.p: Normally defaulting to Sheet1, developers may customize the name given to a Worksheet during the automatic export process with this property.

For security reasons, the property strictly filters the worksheet name, and may truncate long names or those that include unusual characters (such as control-characters, whitespace and punctuation). If a web application requires constraints to be relaxed, or wishes to provide its own restrictions on the property assigned at run-time, then the security-conscious developer may handle the event to provide his/her own validations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.DownloadName
member.summary: Filename given to the Workbook downloaded to the client during export.

remarks.p: Developers should customize the filename given to the exported file downloaded to the client (or launched in-place within the client's browser) with this property. The file name must be a legal filename on the client's operating system, and must end with an ".XLS" file extension (the file extension is automatically added, if omitted.)

Developers cannot specify a path within this property, as the end user may choose to save the file at any location on their local file system (typically the path defaults to the end user's Documents folder).

For security reasons, the property strictly filters the filename, and may truncate long filenames or those that specify a path. If a web application requires constraints to be relaxed, or wishes to provide its own restrictions on the property assigned at run-time, then security-conscious developers may handle the event.

It is recommended that the download filename be dynamically determined by developers' web applications, because some versions of the Microsoft Internet Explorer browser may fail to open the spreadsheet as expected if a file of the same name already exists within the end user's Temporary Internet Files cache.
This property defaults to the ID of the exported UltraWebGrid, if its value is left unspecified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.ExcelStartRow
member.summary: Starting Excel row where grid data is exported into the document.

remarks.p: Excel row numbers range from 1 to 65,536 (i.e., they are one-based).

Developers may specify a starting location in the exported document other than the top-left corner by setting ExcelStartRow and . For instance, this could be useful to export UltraWebGrid data beneath the custom formatting of letterhead or a standard corporate template.
Excel supports a maximum of 65,536 rows. An export operation may fail if the ExcelStartRow is set too close to the bottom for UltraWebGrid data to fit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.ExcelStartColumn
member.summary: Starting Excel column where grid data is exported into the document.

remarks.p: Excel column identifiers range from A to IV. The first twenty-six columns are identified by the single letters A through Z, and then every subsequent set of 26 columns is differentiated by a different starting letter (i.e., AA-AZ, BA-BZ through to IA-IV).

Developers may specify a starting column in the exported document other than the top-left corner by setting and ExcelStartColumn. For instance, this could be useful to export UltraWebGrid data alongside the custom formatting of a standard corporate template or left-hand side callouts.
Excel supports a maximum of 256 columns. An export operation may fail if the ExcelStartColumn is set too far to the right for the UltraWebGrid data to fit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.TypeCoercion
member.summary: Configures the effort applied to coercing weakly-typed columns into underlying data values.
member.value: The Default setting performs normal type coercion which is sufficient for most applications; a ConvertText setting will apply more stringent parsing and conversion based on the DataType of the UltraGridColumn being exported but this takes longer.

remarks.p: The Default setting provides all normal Excel formatting for UltraGridColumns containing numeric and date/time values when the Value property of their cells returns them as their true data type. Use it for all general export operations.

The ConvertText setting is slower, but parses text values (when the Value property of the cell returns a String object) into the true data type according to the DataType set on the UltraGridColumn where possible. Its use is only advisable when an application has provided the UltraWebGrid with type information and must export untyped XML or custom data objects that yield only text properties.
Developers can frequently avoid needing to set this property to ConvertText by ensuring the data is strongly-typed before data-binding to the UltraWebGrid.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.BeginExport
member.summary: Occurs before the UltraWebGrid export starts.

remarks.p: The Layout argument returns a reference to a cloned UltraGridLayout used for excel exporting. Any changes you make to this layout will be reflected in exported file and not in the original grid layout.
The Rows argument returns a reference to a original rows collection in top band.
Additionally, this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before all other events. You can use it to do any preprocessing before exporting process starts. For example, you can set properties on cloned layout or write some custom header to Excel workbook.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.InitializeRow
member.summary: Occurs when each UltraWebGrid row is initialized.

remarks.p: The Row argument returns a reference to a grid row which is being exported.
The SkipRow argument specifies whether to skip the current row. This argument doesn't affect exporting of descendant rows.
The SkipDescendants argument specifies whether to skip the descendats of the current row.
The SkipSiblings argument specifies whether to skip sibling rows of the current row.
The TerminateExport argument specifies whether to terminate the export process. Current row will not be processed.
Additionally, this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired for every grid row which is being exported, and before and are fired. Use this event to set grid row specific properties and to control exporting process.

remarks.p: The GridRow argument returns a reference to row being exported.
Additionally, this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before an Excel row with grid data is processed. Use Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If grid rows spans multiple Excel rows (like in row layout mode), this event is fired only for first row.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.EndExport
member.summary: Occurs after the UltraWebGrid export is finished.

remarks.p: The Cancelled argument is true if exporting process has been cancelled.
This event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired after the exporting process has finished and is fired after all other events. The exported document is not sent to the client until the processing of the web form completes. Developers may handle this event for any post-processing of the finished Microsoft Excel Workbook before it is serialized to the client.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraWebGridExcelExporter.NameValidating
member.summary: Occurs when the DownloadName or WorksheetName properties are being validated.

remarks.p: The PropertyName argument names the property.
The ProposedName argument contains the requested value for the property being validated.
The OriginalName argument contains the previous value for the property being validated.
The Cancel argument allows the developer to revert back to the value in the original name property.

The ApprovedName argument contains the value that will be used for the property (initially it contains a pre-filtered value that has been checked for any character that could possibly be problematic.)
Important! Overriding the constraints on the DownloadName and WorksheetName properties can lead to undefined behavior. Never allow unvalidated user input to be assigned to these properties.
The NameValidating event fires when the or properties are validated during an assignment.

Developers may handle this event when they want to add additional security checks which exceed what the UltraWebGridExcelExporter already performs on these properties. An event handler can cancel an assignment and revert to the property's original value.

The constraints on what constitute a valid name for these properties can also be relaxed by developers handling this event. An event handler may elect to approve a name that ordinarily would not be permitted.

There are risks involved in overriding the default constraints imposed by the UltraWebGridExcelExporter. These are enforced when it pre-screens these names and filters out troublesome characters, but these restrictions can be bypassed when an application handles this event.

These property values appear in network protocol control fields, such as the HTTP (Hyper Text Transport Protocol) header, and are assumed valid for use in unmanaged operating system function calls by Microsoft Excel. Behavior is undefined when certain invalid characters appear in these names, and determination of what constitutes an invalid character may depend on the intervening network topology and platform of the end user's machine. For UltraWebGridExcelExporter to remain secure by default, the rules applied as it filters names assigned to these properties is highly restrictive.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExcelExport.UltraGridExporterHelper.Infragistics#WebUI#UltraWebGrid#IUltraGridExporter#EndExport(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Concludes the export processing.
member.param: Flag indicating whether the developer has aborted the export before all rows have been exported.

remarks.p: This method is normally called when all of the rows defined in an earlier call to have been exported into the alternate format. In these circumstances, the cancelled parameter will always be False to indicate success.

An export operation may be cancelled prematurely by passing a True value in the TerminateExport of the processRowParams argument to . In this case, EndExport is called with a True value in its cancelled parameter.
